page.title: 15Lion House Park, Hailsham
page.content: An alternative type of housing becoming increasingly popular in the 1980s are Park Homes due to the continual rise in price of conventional houses. They are sited on what were previously known as Caravan Parks - areas of land licensed by Local Authorities for this use. Lion House Park which is situated on the outskirts of Hailsham is a typical example. This development of 112 Park Homes has attracted folk from all over the country wishing to retire to Sussex. A condition of occupation is that residents must be retired and no pets are allowed. Park Home dwellers form a very close knit community. At Lion House they have a Club Room where leisure activities abound. Each day there is something organised, Whist Drives, Bingo, Tea Dances etc. where it is easy to make friends.
